content.raw: @ericr86, do you have any thoughts on including a test like this, or on the test itself?
content.html: @ericr86, do you have any thoughts on including a test like this, or on the test itself?

content.raw:
I like the idea of additional tests and especially for subsegments.

I only have a few questions/comments:
- Is there output from the posterior task that we could baseline and test against as well?
- What version of GMTK are you using? Unlike some of the older tests it might be worthwhile for newer tests to mention exactly what version of external software you are using to make sure things are reproducible.
content.html:
I like the idea of additional tests and especially for subsegments.

I only have a few questions/comments: - Is there output from the posterior task that we could baseline and test against as well? - What version of GMTK are you using? Unlike some of the older tests it might be worthwhile for newer tests to mention exactly what version of external software you are using to make sure things are reproducible.

content.raw:
The posterior behavior with sublabels was actually changed in the other open pull request, so if we want the posterior output to be part of the same test, we could work on that one first, I think it's ready for review as well.

It's GMTK 1.0.1, should that go in the readme file?

Edit: [link to other pull request](#!/hoffmanlab/segway/pull-request/8/posterior-compatibility-with-sublabel/diff)
content.html:
The posterior behavior with sublabels was actually changed in the other open pull request, so if we want the posterior output to be part of the same test, we could work on that one first, I think it's ready for review as well.

Edit: link to other pull request

content.raw:
It's probably a good idea to wait until the posterior pull request is in since this test would ideally test the posterior case as well.

I would probably put a small comment about the GMTK version in the test script somewhere. There should be a better way of doing this but for now I think that's the best solution.

The README/docs need to be updated in general. Right now IIRC the recommended installation for GMTK is the ticket 161-2 branch. In this case (for the test) I don't believe it matters what version as much as there is a record of how to reproduce the results especially if GMTK can potentially change the results significantly enough.
